overview_summary: All three profiled neighbors have no documented stance on the development (each classified as "unknown" in noted_stance). Similarly, none hold notable public offices or community leadership roles – there are no high-influence neighbors in this group, as all have relatively low community profiles.

neighbors.name: Josue & Diana Flores
neighbors.claims: Josue and Diana Flores are listed as owners of Cochise County parcel 106-06-019A according to county property records ([www.cochise.az.gov](https://www.cochise.az.gov/178/Assessor#:~:text=The%20Cochise%20County%20Assessor%27s%20Office,Senior%20Property%20Valuation%20Protection%20Option)). No record of public comments or positions by the Flores family on development issues was found in local archives ([saddlebagnotes.com](https://saddlebagnotes.com/news/local/article_3030c105-5b22-5ceb-83af-8ea985fd6dc0.html#:~:text=Prominent%20pecan%20grower%20Dick%20Walden%2C,that%20can%20be%20pumped%20affordably)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate contact with a friendly, personal introduction to understand their perspective, since they have not voiced any public stance. Emphasize open communication and explain how the project will respect local landowner interests.

neighbors.name: Loren J. Sheldon
neighbors.claims: Loren J. Sheldon is the recorded owner of parcel 106-06-020 in Cochise County’s property ownership records ([www.cochise.az.gov](https://www.cochise.az.gov/178/Assessor#:~:text=The%20Cochise%20County%20Assessor%27s%20Office,Senior%20Property%20Valuation%20Protection%20Option)). He has not been identified in local news or public meetings regarding land development, suggesting no documented stance or public involvement ([saddlebagnotes.com](https://saddlebagnotes.com/news/local/article_3030c105-5b22-5ceb-83af-8ea985fd6dc0.html#:~:text=Prominent%20pecan%20grower%20Dick%20Walden%2C,that%20can%20be%20pumped%20affordably)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Mr. Sheldon one-on-one given his low public profile, listening to any concerns he raises about land use. Build trust by acknowledging rural values and explaining measures the project will take to preserve the local quality of life.

neighbors.name: Richard E. & Julia Ann Wilson
neighbors.claims: Richard E. Wilson and Julia Ann Wilson are listed as co-owners of Cochise County parcel 106-06-018P in official property records ([www.cochise.az.gov](https://www.cochise.az.gov/178/Assessor#:~:text=The%20Cochise%20County%20Assessor%27s%20Office,Senior%20Property%20Valuation%20Protection%20Option)). No public statements or involvement in local land-use issues by the Wilsons could be found in community records ([saddlebagnotes.com](https://saddlebagnotes.com/news/local/article_3030c105-5b22-5ceb-83af-8ea985fd6dc0.html#:~:text=Prominent%20pecan%20grower%20Dick%20Walden%2C,that%20can%20be%20pumped%20affordably)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out to the Wilsons personally to introduce the project and invite their questions, as they have maintained a low profile. Be prepared to discuss any property impact and highlight community benefits that would matter to long-time local residents.
